content.prompt: Which of the following best explains the change in the moose population from 1995 to 1997?

choices.label: The large moose population led to a significant increase in the wolf population from 1995 to 1996, leading to increased predation of moose by wolves.
The high density of moose in the population led to a large number of moose emigrating from the island in search of mates and territory.
Plants in the area could not support the large population of moose in 1995.
The small number of wolves on the island could not support the large number of moose in 1995.

skill.text: Skill 5.E: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about environmental issues.
